### Week 3: Issues of diversity and bias in psychological and neuroscience research
<br>

#### Before the workshop:
<p>
<ul>
<li>First, <a href="/workshop_files/2023/research-skills/Hruschka_Diversity.pdf" download>read this paper</a> from Hruschka et al. (2018).
<li>Then, <a href="/workshop_files/2023/research-skills/Clark_RetractedPaper.pdf" download>read this paper</a> from Clark et al. (2020). <font color="#D6494A">Note that this paper has since been retracted and is *not* an example of good research.</font>
</ul>

### Week 8: Science communication
<br>

No pre-workshop video or materials. Slides will be provided after the workshop.

<br><br>
<hr>

### Week 9: Mini-conference office hours / Q&A
<br>

During this session, we will be available to help with presentations for the end-of-summer SIPPS mini-conference. Any questions are welcome, about any stage of the research/presentation process (e.g., coding, stats, presentation formatting, etc).

<ul>
<li>For workshop-only students, there’s no need to attend this workshop session, but you’re welcome to join if you’d like! As long as there’s time, we’ll be happy to address other SIPPS-/research-related questions that don’t specifically pertain to final presentations.
</ul>
